intro: Gynochthodes hollrungiana, commonly known as the red-flowered rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically red or pink in color, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
